programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: A young public relations exec goes on a remarkably disastrous blind date that threatens to upend his entire life while opening him up to true love.

programme.title: The Pest
programme.desc: A manic con man finds himself the prey of a high-speed hunt that migrates from a neo-Nazi's private island to the streets of Miami's South Beach.

programme.title: Wilder Napalm
programme.desc: Sparks fly when two brothers, a workaday joe and a circus performer, who possess pyrokinetic minds, start fires and vie for the love of one hot woman.

programme.title: Wings of Courage
programme.desc: The film tells the dramatic story of three legendary French aviators and the first historic airmail flights in the Andes. It combines a tale of high adventure and excitement with cutting-edge technology, and is the fulfillment of one of Annaud's long-held dreams.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: During a hiking trip, the President's daughter gets kidnapped. Now it is up to Agent McGregor and a river guide to rescue her before it is too late.

programme.title: First Target
programme.desc: A group of deadly assassins targets the US President as he tours a state park aboard a tram, and it's up to Secret Service agent, Alex, to stop them.

programme.title: First Shot
programme.desc: A sniper's bullet has left the President in critical condition. Now a secret service agent must track down the terrorists behind the attack.

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesn’t hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: Set in 1965, a 15-year-old girl with dreams of becoming a writer gets pregnant and enters a failed marriage with the baby’s drug-addicted father.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenage girl struggles to balance the trials of high school, the discipline of martial arts, and the thrill of her first romance.

programme.title: Swept From the Sea
programme.desc: Amy, a servant girl, and Yanko, the sole survivor of a capsized ship bound for America, begin a fiery affair at the end of the nineteenth century.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Company of Heroes
programme.desc: Set during World War II, Company of Heroes, follows US military units during the Battle of Normandy and the Allied liberation of France.

programme.title: About Last Night...
programme.desc: After Danny and his new girlfriend Debbie move in together, the two are bombarded with advice from their disapproving pals, Bernie and Joan.

programme.title: Nothing in Common
programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: The Jolson Story
programme.desc: At the turn of the 20th century, young Asa Yoelson (Scotty Beckett) decides to go against the wishes of his cantor father (Ludwig Donath) and pursue a career in show business. Gradually working his way up through the vaudeville ranks, Asa -- now calling himself Al Jolson (Larry Parks) -- joins a blackface minstrel troupe and soon builds a reputation as a consummate performer. But as his career grows in size, so does his ego, resulting in battles in business as well as in his personal life.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Fort Ti
programme.desc: Capt. Horn (George Montgomery) and Rogers' Rangers raid Fort Ticonderoga during the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: The Return of Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The scout's grandson (Bill Elliott) foils land-grabbers; his sidekick (Dub Taylor) flirts with twins.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Thieves plot to rob the Los Angeles Coliseum box office during a Rams game.

programme.title: Yolanda and the Thief
programme.desc: A con man poses as a Latin American heiress' guardian angel.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: An American in Paris
programme.desc: Gene Kelly sings and dances his way through Paris as a WWII veteran.

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: A swinging bachelor finds love when he meets a girl immune to his line.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.title: David Copperfield (1935)
programme.desc: Charles Dickens' classic tale of an orphaned boy's fight for happiness.

programme.title: Hysteria
programme.desc: An American suffering from amnesia after a car accident tries to remember his true identity, but stumbles onto a murder plot in the process.

programme.title: Horror of Dracula
programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.title: The Curse of Frankenstein
programme.desc: A scientist creates a monster from a few body parts and buckets of blood.

programme.title: Doctor X
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a series of cannibalistic murders at a college.

programme.title: Task Force
programme.desc: A naval officer devotes his life to the development of an aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: An unemployed saleswoman gets mistaken as the mother of an abandoned baby.

programme.title: The Falcon Takes Over
programme.desc: The Falcon and a reporter try to track down a murderous thug's girlfriend.

programme.title: The Falcon in San Francisco
programme.desc: A society sleuth enlists a girl's help in nabbing a mob of silk smugglers.

programme.title: The Falcon Out West
programme.desc: A society sleuth turns cowboy to investigate a Texas murder.

programme.title: The Falcon's Alibi
programme.desc: A society sleuth sets out on the trail of a society matron's lost jewels.

programme.title: The Falcon's Adventure
programme.desc: A society sleuth rescues a kidnapped woman, then is framed for murder.

programme.title: A Date with the Falcon
programme.desc: The detective postpones his wedding to find a cache of stolen diamonds.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: Johnny Eager
programme.desc: A racketeer seduces the DA's daughter for revenge, then falls in love.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a Marine recruiter is murdered, the team delves into the world of military enlistment to try to find the killer; Natalia must face her ex-husband when he asks out one of her co-workers.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team must find a suspected terrorist, who goes on the run after a failed attempt on her life.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, the lab's night shift and Calleigh's ex-boyfriend must find evidence that proves Natalia's innocence when she is accused of her ex-husband's murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the bomb squad must defuse a land mine before it detonates; Delko is sued for his role in a domestic dispute.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Hijackers take a truck full of confiscated weapons, and Horatio links the crime to Clavo Cruz; a confiscated missile launched into the courthouse helps Clavo escape; a member of Horatio's team is fatally shot.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A member of the team fights for his life after being shot in the head; the hunt for Clavo Cruz continues.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates when the parents of a baby sitter in an upscale neighborhood are murdered; key evidence leads Horatio to expose a doctor who has dirty secrets.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence suggests foul play after a member of a hunting group is mauled by a bear.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a wealthy real-estate developer (Colin Ferguson) is killed, the team suspects his wife, then realizes that she is a triplet with identical sisters.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio suspects that owners of an American Indian casino are involved in a murder victim's scalping.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a movie star who was on the verge of exposing damaging secrets.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A skull smashes the windshield of a car driven by a group of teenagers on the freeway; a trail of suspects leads Brennan and Booth to a strange cannibalistic society; Cam suggests that Angela hire a private investigator to find her ex-husband.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate when a soccer mom is blown up in her minivan; the investigation uncovers that the woman was a member of the National Liberation Army.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates a footless corpse that was found in the woods; Brennan and Booth's questioning leads to several suspects, including the victim's wife; Angela agrees to undergo hypnosis to remember her former husband's name.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the founder of an organic supermarket chain is found dead, Brennan and Booth suspect foul play by a rival farmer; the two agents visit a new psychiatrist, who warns that the FBI may separate them.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When mummified remains are found at Halloween attractions, Brennan and Booth realize that they must find the killer by Halloween or there will be another death.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team suspects colleagues when the remains of a young Jeffersonian intern are found in the building's incinerator; Booth poses as Cam's boyfriend and accompanies her on a family get-together.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When high-school classmates reunite to unearth a time capsule buried 20 years earlier, they find the corpse of an adolescent friend inside; while combing through the victim's life, the team members rehash their own teen years.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After construction workers find an archbishop's body with the kneecaps surgically removed, the team returns to the case of the Widow's Son serial killer.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Three days before Christmas the body of a bearded man in a tailor-made Santa outfit turns up in a sewer; Brennan visits her father in prison and plots a nontraditional holiday reunion.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the remains of a professional motorcycle racer are found in a hot spring, the team suspects his rival to be the murderer; Dr. Lance Sweets forces Booth and Brennan to accompany him on a double date.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the college-basketball world to determine who is responsible for the murder of a player on a nationally ranked team.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After a woman's car is run off the road, only her baby survives; Booth and Brennan go to the woman's hometown to investigate.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby and Michelle investigate a string of high-tech thefts in Vancouver.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby and Michelle search for a dangerous gang while feeling the pressure of the new police superintendent.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: When Tia's colleague is targeted by a hotel owner, Toby pushes for an investigation.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby and Michelle search for a killer suspected of taking national defense secrets.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When an 8-year-old is found dead on the Appalachian Trail, the team searches the forests for a man targeting children.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team pursues a killer who targets women; Hotchner turns to an FBI cadet for help.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After helping a man get parole, Morgan regrets his decision when the man murders someone shortly after being released.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A series of bizarre, ritualistic murders brings the team to Miami; Reid experiences hallucinations and blinding headaches.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team pursues two young lovers on a killing spree; Prentiss receives frightening news.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates unusual murders in Los Angeles, and more information about Prentiss' past arises.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU heads to upstate New York to investigate mysterious disappearances; Prentiss receives troubling news about a former colleague.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Reid's ability to connect with an autistic child may prove helpful in finding the boy's missing parents; two former colleagues help Prentiss search for an old adversary.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After a series of murders, Prentiss becomes suspicious of a former nemesis (Sebastian Roché) and fears for the safety of her team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Prentiss prepares to confront her nemesis at last; the team asks J.J. to help find Prentiss and capture Doyle.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must stop a gang of suspected murderers that is targeting a new victim nightly.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must investigate targeted killings in Florida while each member is dealing with feelings about losing Prentiss.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A stalker in San Diego targets college students; Strauss scrutinizes the team after the loss of Prentiss.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...

programme.desc: Grunge icon Scott Weiland died on Dec. 3, 2015, at the age of 48; his death came suddenly while on the road with his band The Wildabouts; Weiland, a singer and songwriter, was known as the last great rock star.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Christopher John Cornell was an American musician, singer and songwriter; he was best known as the lead vocalist for the rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave; Cornell struggled with depression for much of his life.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Known as the founder of the Van Halen, a band synonymous with California cool, Eddie Van Halen sold multiple platinum albums and cemented himself in rock 'n' roll history; behind his contagious smile, there was a darker undercurrent.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: On Oct. 2, 2017, news of Tom Petty's sudden death at the age of 66 shocked the nation.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Prince, the pop superstar who sold over 100 million records over a 30 year career, was fit, health-conscious, and vehemently anti-drugs, and yet, on April 21, 2016, Prince died, shockingly, of a drug overdose; the case is still under investigation.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: At 9:50 a.m. on Aug. 16, 2018, Aretha Franklin tragically died; Aretha, one of the world's greatest vocalists, entertained audiences for over 50 years with her unique brand of gospel, soul and pop music.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Florence Ballard, a founding member of the popular Motown vocal female group the Supremes, leaves the group in 1967; she makes an attempt for a musical comeback but dies of a heart attack in February 1976 at the age of 32.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Daughter of Nat `King' Cole, Natalie Cole was a unique singing legend but in 2008 her dark past caught up with her and set off an extraordinary chain reaction of medical conditions.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: After nearly 40 years as the Queen of Disco and First Lady of Love, Donna Summer died from cancer at her home in Naples, Fla., on May 17, 2012, with the public having no idea she was ill.

programme.desc: Rick Harrison arrives at the shop looking for a birthday present for his son.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A client brings in a rare British motorcycle from the 1950s; the team puts in their two cents on a 1940s Accurate Weight penny scale.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Bodie restores a 1941 Plymouth Special Deluxe for the CEO of Carl's Jr.; Dale is in a hurry to build a bike in time for his museum's annual motorcycle raffle; Andy restores a 1952 Shuffle Bowler game that might have ties to the mafia.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: NASCAR driver Greg Biffle asks Rick to restore his 1970s Montesa motorcycle; 1950s Kidillac.

programme.desc: A 1960s Pak Trak hunting scooter is brought to the shop; Rick calls Danny The Count to check out the unique dirt mobile; Kelly purchases a classic Mosrite guitar for Brettly's birthday.

programme.desc: A 1967 Honda Scrambler motorcycle arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew look at some of the most classic rides in the history of Counting Cars: a museum worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon; a 1960 Cadillac coupe; a tricked out '35 Ford pickup street rod; a 1953 Henry J Corsair.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to score an ex-police motorcycle without getting busted, while a watermain break threatens to put the shop permanently under water.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Like in the cartoons, the Plymouth Road Runner has always eluded Danny.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes a plan to put the Count's Kustoms touch on a classic Harley Davidson that he hopes to sell for a big profit.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big plans for a big client. But will his evil twist on a classic Caddy impress the high rolling buyer, or leave him all out of gas?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big retro plans for a 1972 Cutlass he hopes to flip, and is counting on his fab team to do her right.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Legendary rocker George Lynch from the metal band Dokken stops by with his very cool 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A customer wants to trick out his 2004 Harley Davidson Road Glide, but both Shannon and Ryan aren't sure they can do everything he wants.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to custom paint a brand new pick-up for a charity auction for the local YMCA.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Shannon honor fallen troops with a custom patriotic motorcycle. Later, Danny and Kevin push the limit to acquire a `71 Monte Carlo, and then have a tough decision.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and Horny Mike make an unauthorized purchase, forcing Danny to teach them a valuable lesson. Later, Danny runs into trouble himself after acquiring a Chevelle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker restores a 1969 Shelby GT500 numbers-matching car from a rust bucket into an instant classic. The team visits the Detroit Autorama.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon recruits the guys to help him finish up a gift for Danny, a bike he started building for him- ten years ago. Meanwhile, Danny spots a 1969 Corvette in a friend's lot.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on the hunt for the thief who stole his boat; Rygaard refuses to allow Oakes to pass through their landing; Clint's boat nearly goes up in smoke; Swilley pulls up a prize from the bottom of the lake.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A misstep by Joe cripples the yarder for Papac; Gabe pulls out a massive feller buncher; the Dreadknots and Chapman try to make it through a dangerous lightning storm.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The war between Rygaard and Oakes explodes after Kelly demolishes a Rygaard pick-up truck; Coatsy makes a drastic decision regarding Joe's employment; the Chapman crew may have found the treasure of a lifetime.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A logging legend bails Gabe out of trouble; Shelby and an old friend use brute force to pull two logs; the Dreadknots bring in a new diver; the Chapman team looks to catch a log poacher.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Oakes Logging crashes onto the Rygaard families site; Shelby and Mike use redneck ingenuity to pull a huge and rare heart-pine log; the Papac team makes reckless Joe the new yarder operator; the Chapman team gets revenge on a suspected log poacher.

programme.desc: Shelby goes diving in gator infested waters; Rygaard and Oakes square off on a way road; the Dreadknots go their separate ways; fire breaks out on the mountain.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It hurts Dog to see people who after years of walking the straight and narrow, suddenly lose their way. But today's case is a member of the law enforcement community who has recently gone astray, and that truly troubles the Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy and today he's proving it. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog pursues two people whose lives have been devastated by drugs. First, he tracks Mae, who traded a good home, loving kids, and an adoring husband for an ice pipe. He busts Mae, but is amazed to discover that her family still showers her with love.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the local cops put out an APB for a client with a checked past, Dog springs into action. With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel. But sometimes the defendant is a threat to the community and the cosigner asks the bondsman for protection.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is trying to cut down on smoking, but it's not easy with his high-stress job. Today, he must track down Walter, a fugitive who believes that the Canadian military has planted a chip in his tooth.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's time is running out in Colorado. After a month of helping his bail bondsmen friends around Denver, he's got to get his family back home to Hawaii. But Dog wants one more capture before they leave.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team begin their day by judging the local elementary school's talent show, where they declare all the kids to be winners.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The team is still in Colorado, and today Dog starts his day by to giving his kids and crew a sample of their western heritage by taking them horseback riding. This hunt takes Dog back to his old stomping grounds in Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth designs a luxurious new office for the team and shows it off to Dog, but the bounty hunter is more interested in starting his hunt for Federico, who's been revoked for missing court dates and generally running amuck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With twelve kids of his own Dog knows how hard it is to keep children on the straight and narrow, especially during their turbulent teens.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For Dog and Beth it's not only another day in paradise, it's their anniversary. Beth is hoping for a romantic dinner with her man, but she knows only too well that for Dog work always comes first.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has history of domestic abuse and assault, and now he's facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Halloween, and before Dog and Beth can help the kids carve their pumpkins, they have some business to attend to. It involves knocking on doors and meeting the neighbors but instead of hunting for treats they're on the search for a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been raining for days and the team is going a little stir crazy. Dog however has the cure--a good hunt. Maui has failed to appear on a drug charge and the team has just one lead.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: Accused of shooting his mother, a son stands trial for murder. With his family testifying for the prosecution, who will the jury believe?

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A terrible car crash leaves a father dead and his son horribly injured. The driver of the other car is miraculously unharmed. Tragic accident or deadly driver'.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A retired coal miner shoots his best friend to death after a Christmas outing takes a terrible turn.

programme.title: Women on Death Row
programme.desc: In 1998, a fire in Sandi Nieves' home that started under suspicious circumstances led to her conviction for arson, the murders of her four daughters, and the attempted murder of her son David, who survived the fire.

programme.title: Women on Death Row
programme.desc: On May 23, 1995, Kerry Lyn Dalton was sentenced to death for the torture and murder of Irene Melanie May; police arrested Kerry and two others after several witnesses told authorities that the three openly bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Women on Death Row
programme.desc: On July 10, 2008, Melissa Lucio was sentenced to death for the murder of her 2-year-old daughter, Mariah; the Innocence Project digs into her case and uncovers staggering problems, but authorities show no sign of intervening.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious symbol of the keyhole exists in mystic texts, sacred architecture and ancient artwork found all over the planet; exploring if this cryptic shape represents a profound connection to the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A multitude of guests and scientists explores everything from human origins to groundbreaking archaeological finds, new understandings of the cosmos, and the profound possibility that humans are not alone in the universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Rebellious angels, giant hybrid beings, and humans taken up to a heavenly realm above the Earth; examining the possiblility that The Book of Enoch was stricken from the Bible because it documents humanity's extraterrestrial origins.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In numerous sacred traditions, the number 12 holds a divine significance; it can be found repeated in ancient architecture, groups of 12 wisdom keepers and even the latest scientific principles.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to the earliest Tibetan traditions, Shambhala, the kingdom of the gods, is hidden high in the Himalaya Mountains; examining if it's possible that this mystical realm truly exists.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient cultures recorded stories of enormous beings that descended from the sky; exploring if massive megalithic structures and reported discoveries of towering human-like skeletons reveal that the world was once inhabited by giants.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: After a series of dark and ominous events, an unassuming family home on Long Island becomes the most notorious house in America; 50 years later, it's spawned a title wave of books, documentaries, and films.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of unexplained deaths near Chicago in 1982 starts a nationwide panic; the victims are connected by one frightening detail: cyanide-tainted capsules of Extra-Strength Tylenol; 40 years later, it remains an active FBI investigation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On November 22, 1963, President John F Kennedy is assassinated, shaking the nation to its core; while an initial suspect is captured, many believe there's more to the story; investigators and amateur sleuths alike have been searching for answers.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1997, thousands of people across Phoenix witness a series of strange lights unlike anything they've ever seen; many think this could be one of the largest-scale UFO sightings in history, but there may be another explanation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1969, a serial killer taunts investigators with cryptic ciphers, leaving police and the public questioning his identity for over 50 years; new evidence and technology may finally be able to crack his code and discover who the Zodiac Killer is.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite centuries of sightings and searches, one deep-sea monster remains unidentified; as evidence continues to mount, the mystery endures as to whether the Loch Ness monster exists.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: Detectives Tim Entenok and Joselito Sandoval are called to a crime scene at Brookside Park at 11:00 am, where a missing person is found dead in a 4-foot-diameter sewage drain.

programme.title: Crime 360

programme.title: Crime 360

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: One part thriller and one part true-crime show, this new series features the real, urgent, unrehearsed, 911 call audio between emergency dispatchers and frantic callers.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: The situations in the this episode are close calls. A pregnant woman in suburban Denver is helpless as she is attacked by her stalker in her secluded home.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: This episode begins with a rural California widow calling 911 in the middle of the night as someone tries to break into her home.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: A mom and her teenage son barricade themselves inside an upstairs closet with no lock and call 911 as an intruder searchers for their hiding place.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: The assistant manager of a sporting goods store calls 911 as one of her customers uses an electric saw to cut his way into the store's ammunition and gun rack.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: When a young woman, home alone, sees two men crawl over her back fence, she dials 911 and as she begins to beg for help, she hears the sound of glass breaking downstairs.

programme.title: Panic 9-1-1
programme.desc: A taxi driver calls 9-1-1 moments after witnessing her last fare commit a violent crime, but while on the phone, her passenger returns and gets back in her cab!

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Near what's known as the hanging tree, the mutilated body of Timothy Coggins is found in late 1983. The investigation is thwarted and the case freezes for over 30 years, until now.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
